channel.title: I get a QEMU error
channel.description: Hello, I installed KVM using wiki doing all exactly as in Wiki cause I'm new to KVM. But now when I start it I get error ERROR: Virtualizer qemu unsupported by Whonix developers! Whonixcheck aborted! (qubes_detected: false) Using Virtualizer qemu together with Whonix is recommended against, because it is rarely tested. [1] [2] [3]

item.title: I get a QEMU error
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
You can update no problem. Please stop spamming the forum with your topic.

Read full topic

item.title: I get a QEMU error
item.dc:creator: Opeq
item.description:
@Patrick Can I update ? It types when I try to update

ERROR: Virtualizer qemu unsupported by Whonix developers! Whonixcheck aborted! (qubes_detected: false)
Using Virtualizer qemu together with Whonix is recommended against, because it is rarely tested. [1] [2] [3] 
It could be made possible, but would require more Whonix contributors. 
It may already work, but is highly experimental. 
This might endanger your anonymity. Do not proceed unless you know what you are doing. 
If you wish to ignore this warning and to continue whonixcheck anyway, you can set 
WHONIXCHECK_NO_EXIT_ON_UNSUPPORTED_VIRTUALIZER="1"
in /etc/whonix.d/30_whonixcheck_default.conf

Can I change

WHONIXCHECK_NO_EXIT_ON_UNSUPPORTED_VIRTUALIZER to “1” and update and after update is finished change WHONIXCHECK_NO_EXIT_ON_UNSUPPORTED_VIRTUALIZER back to “0” ?
Also can it endanger my anonymity or it’s just a bug ?

Read full topic

item.description:
you can update I think

Read full topic
